014package org.jdbi.v3.core.argument;
015
016import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
017import java.sql.SQLException;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
020
021/**
022 * An Argument which uses {@code setObject} to support
023 * vendor specific types.
024 */
025public class ObjectArgument implements Argument {
026    private final Object value;
027    private final Integer sqlType;
028
029    /**
030     * Bind a vendor-supported object with the given SQL type.
031     * @param value the value to call @link {@link PreparedStatement#setObject(int, Object)} with
032     * @param sqlType the type to bind
033     * @see java.sql.Types
034     * @deprecated use {@link #of(Object, Integer)} factory method for more consistent {@code null} handling
035     */
036    @Deprecated
037    public ObjectArgument(Object value, Integer sqlType) {
038        this.sqlType = sqlType;
039        this.value = value;
040
041        if (sqlType == null && value == null) {
042            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Null value provided without a type");
043        }
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * Bind a vendor-supported object with the given SQL type.
048     * @param value the value to call @link {@link PreparedStatement#setObject(int, Object)} with
049     * @return the Argument
050     */
051    public static Argument of(Object value) {
052        return of(value, null);
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Bind a vendor-supported object with the given SQL type.
057     * @param value the value to call @link {@link PreparedStatement#setObject(int, Object, int)} with
058     * @param sqlType the type to bind
059     * @return the Argument
060     * @see java.sql.Types
061     */
062    public static Argument of(Object value, Integer sqlType) {
063        if (value == null) {
064            return new NullArgument(sqlType);
065        }
066        return new ObjectArgument(value, sqlType);
067    }
068
069    @Override
070    public void apply(final int position, PreparedStatement statement, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
071        if (value == null) { // remove this clause when constructor is no longer public
072            statement.setNull(position, sqlType); // lgtm[java/dereferenced-value-may-be-null] - guarded by constructor check
073        } else {
074            if (sqlType == null) {
075                statement.setObject(position, value);
076            } else {
077                statement.setObject(position, value, sqlType);
078            }
079        }
080    }
081
082    @Override
083    public String toString() {
084        return (value == null ? "NULL" : String.valueOf(value))
085            + (sqlType == null ? "" : " (type " + sqlType + ")");
086    }
087}
